title: May you relate philosophy of law with philosophy of life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Granting that “philosophy of life” is very vague, I’ll assume it means “what values and actions are best for you as you go through all aspects of living.” That said, the necessary similarities I see have to do with the word “balance.” What each of us has is time, energy, talents and money. The last of these four is any and all material wealth we have control over, in any and all forms thereof. In law, all four have value. If other persons take any of the four from you, you have the legal right to be justly compensated for that which was taken. Balance. As for “”philosophy of life,” each of us values these four factors in proportions best suited to ourselves. Our ranking of them provides the scale by which each of us determines their relative importance, and from that determines our actions day by day, year by year, and so on. Balance. Chris Schneider
